},\"getMin\":function() { return 0; },\"getMax\":function() { return 99; },\"compiledMin\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"0\"},\"compiledMax\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"99\"},\"compiledStep\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"1\"},\"display\":\"infectiousness\",\"left\":31,\"top\":104,\"right\":225,\"bottom\":137,\"varName\":\"infectiousness\",\"min\":\"0.0\",\"max\":\"99.0\",\"default\":65.0,\"step\":\"1.0\",\"units\":\"%\",\"direction\":\"horizontal\",\"type\":\"slider\"},\n{\"compiledSource\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"Call(procedures.setup);\"},\"left\":53,\"top\":65,\"right\":123,\"bottom\":100,\"source\":\"setup\",\"forever\":false,\"buttonType\":\"OBSERVER\",\"actionKey\":null,\"type\":\"button\"},\n{\"compiledSource\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"Call(procedures.go);\"},\"left\":129,\"top\":65,\"right\":200,\"bottom\":101,\"source\":\"go\",\"forever\":true,\"buttonType\":\"OBSERVER\",\"actionKey\":null,\"type\":\"button\"},\n{\"compiledSetupCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', undefined)(function() {}); });\\n}\"},\"compiledUpdateCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', undefined)(function() {}); });\\n}\"},\"compiledPens\":[{\"compiledSetupCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'sick')(function() {}); });\\n}\"},\"compiledUpdateCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() {\\n    plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'sick')(function() {\\n      plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable(\\\"sick?\\\"); }).size());;\\n    });\\n  });\\n}\"},\"display\":\"sick\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-2674135,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles with [sick?]\",\"type\":\"pen\"},{\"compiledSetupCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'immune')(function() {}); });\\n}\"},\"compiledUpdateCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() {\\n    plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'immune')(function() {\\n      plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable(\\\"immune?\\\"); }).size());;\\n    });\\n  });\\n}\"},\"display\":\"immune\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-7500403,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles with [immune?]\",\"type\":\"pen\"},{\"compiledSetupCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'healthy')(function() {}); });\\n}\"},\"compiledUpdateCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() {\\n    plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'healthy')(function() {\\n      plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return (!SelfPrims.getVariable(\\\"sick?\\\") && !SelfPrims.getVariable(\\\"immune?\\\")); }).size());;\\n    });\\n  });\\n}\"},\"display\":\"healthy\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-10899396,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles with [not sick? and not immune?]\",\"type\":\"pen\"},{\"compiledSetupCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'total')(function() {}); });\\n}\"},\"compiledUpdateCode\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"function() {\\n  workspace.rng.withAux(function() {\\n    plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'total')(function() { plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().size());; });\\n  });\\n}\"},\"display\":\"total\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-13345367,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles\",\"type\":\"pen\"}],\"display\":\"Populations\",\"left\":6,\"top\":255,\"right\":258,\"bottom\":419,\"xAxis\":\"weeks\",\"yAxis\":\"people\",\"xmin\":0.0,\"xmax\":52.0,\"ymin\":0.0,\"ymax\":200.0,\"autoPlotOn\":true,\"legendOn\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"\",\"pens\":[{\"display\":\"sick\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-2674135,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles with [sick?]\",\"type\":\"pen\"},{\"display\":\"immune\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-7500403,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles with [immune?]\",\"type\":\"pen\"},{\"display\":\"healthy\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-10899396,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles with [not sick? and not immune?]\",\"type\":\"pen\"},{\"display\":\"total\",\"interval\":1.0,\"mode\":0,\"color\":-13345367,\"inLegend\":true,\"setupCode\":\"\",\"updateCode\":\"plot count turtles\",\"type\":\"pen\"}],\"type\":\"plot\"},\n{\"getStep\":function() { return 1; },\"getMin\":function() { return 10; },\"getMax\":function() { return 300; },\"compiledMin\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"10\"},\"compiledMax\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"300\"},\"compiledStep\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"1\"},\"display\":\"people\",\"left\":31,\"top\":27,\"right\":225,\"bottom\":60,\"varName\":\"people\",\"min\":\"10\",\"max\":\"300\",\"default\":150.0,\"step\":\"1\",\"direction\":\"horizontal\",\"type\":\"slider\"},\n{\"reporter\":function() { return world.observer.getGlobal(\"%infected\"); },\"compiledSource\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"world.observer.getGlobal(\\\"%infected\\\")\"},\"left\":20,\"top\":208,\"right\":95,\"bottom\":253,\"source\":\"%infected\",\"precision\":1,\"fontSize\":11,\"type\":\"monitor\"},\n{\"reporter\":function() { return world.observer.getGlobal(\"%immune\"); },\"compiledSource\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"world.observer.getGlobal(\\\"%immune\\\")\"},\"left\":96,\"top\":208,\"right\":170,\"bottom\":253,\"source\":\"%immune\",\"precision\":1,\"fontSize\":11,\"type\":\"monitor\"},\n{\"reporter\":function() { return (world.ticker.tickCount() / 52); },\"compiledSource\":{\"success\":true,\"result\":\"(world.ticker.tickCount() / 52)\"},\"display\":\"years\",\"left\":171,\"top\":208,\"right\":245,\"bottom\":253,\"source\":\"ticks / 52\",\"precision\":1,\"fontSize\":11,\"type\":\"monitor\"}]";
                                  var code    = "turtles-own\n  [ sick?        ;; if true, the turtle is infectious\n    immune?      ;; if true, the turtle can't be infected\n    sick-count   ;; how long the turtle has been infectious\n    age ]        ;; how many weeks old the turtle is\n\nglobals\n[\n  %infected            ;; what % of the population is infectious\n  %immune              ;; what % of the population is immune\n  lifespan             ;; the average lifespan of a turtle\n  average-offspring    ;; the average number of offspring a turtle could have\n  carrying-capacity    ;; the number of turtles that can be in the world at one time\n]\n\n;; The setup is divided into three subroutines\nto setup\n  clear-all\n  setup-constants\n  setup-turtles\n  update-global-variables\n  reset-ticks\nend\n\n;; We create a variable number of turtles of which 10 are infectious,\n;; and distribute them randomly\nto setup-turtles\n  set-default-shape turtles \"person\"\n  crt people\n    [ setxy random-xcor random-ycor\n      set age random lifespan\n      set sick-count 0\n      set immune? false\n      set size 1.5  ;; easier to see\n      get-healthy ]\n  ask n-of 10 turtles\n    [ get-sick ]\nend\n\nto get-sick ;; turtle procedure\n  set sick? true\n  set immune? false\n  set color red\nend\n\nto get-healthy ;; turtle procedure\n  set sick? false\n  set immune? false\n  set sick-count 0\n  set color green\nend\n\nto become-immune ;; turtle procedure\n  set sick? false\n  set sick-count 0\n  set immune? true\n  set color gray\nend\n\nto setup-constants\n  set lifespan 100\n  set carrying-capacity 750\n  set average-offspring 4\nend\n\nto go\n  get-older\n  move\n  infect\n  recover\n  reproduce\n  update-global-variables\n  tick\nend\n\nto update-global-variables\n  if count turtles > 0\n  [\n    set %infected (count turtles with [sick?]) / (count turtles) * 100\n    set %immune (count turtles with [immune?]) / (count turtles) * 100\n  ]\nend\n\n;;Turtle counting variables are advanced.\nto get-older\n  ask turtles\n  [\n    set age age + 1\n    if sick?\n      [ set sick-count (sick-count + 1) ]\n    ;; Turtles die of old age once their age equals the\n    ;; lifespan (set at 100 in this model).\n    if age > lifespan\n      [ die ]\n  ]\nend\n\n;;Turtles move about at random.\nto move\n  ask turtles\n  [ rt random 100\n    lt random 100\n    fd 1 ]\nend\n\n;; If a turtle is sick, it infects other turtles on the same patch.\n;; Immune turtles don't get sick.\nto infect\n  ask turtles with [sick?]\n    [ ask other turtles-here with [ not immune? ]\n        [ if (random-float 100) < infectiousness\n            [ get-sick ] ] ]\nend\n\n;; Once the turtle has been sick long enough, it\n;; either recovers (and becomes immune) or it dies.\nto recover\n   ask turtles with [sick?]\n     [ if (random sick-count) > (lifespan * (duration / 100))  ;; If the turtle has survived past the virus' duration, then\n         [ ifelse ((random-float 100) < chance-recover)        ;; either recover or die\n             [ become-immune ]\n             [ die ] ] ]\nend\n\n;; If there are less turtles than the carrying-capacity\n;;  then turtles can reproduce.\n;; The probability of reproduction depends on average number\n;;  of offspring per life.  In this model it is 4 per life (e.g.\n;;  4 per 100 weeks.  The chance, therefore, for a turtle to\n;;  reproduce at any given turn is 0.04 (if the population\n;;  is below carrying-capacity).\nto reproduce\n  ask turtles with [not sick?]\n    [ if (count turtles) < carrying-capacity\n         and (random lifespan) < average-offspring\n       [ hatch 1\n           [ set age 1\n             lt 45 fd 1\n             get-healthy ] ] ]\nend";
                                  var info    = "## WHAT IS IT?\n\nThis model simulates the transmission and perpetuation of a virus in a human population.\n\nEcological biologists have suggested a number of factors which may influence the survival of a directly transmitted virus within a population. (Yorke, et al. \"Seasonality and the requirements for perpetuation and eradication of viruses in populations.\" Journal of Epidemiology, volume 109, pages 103-123)\n\n## HOW IT WORKS\n\nThe model is initialized with 150 people, of which 10 are infected.  People move randomly about the world in one of three states: healthy but susceptible to infection (green), sick and infectious (red), and healthy and immune (gray). People may die of infection or old age.  When the population dips below the environment's \"carrying capacity\" (set at 700 in this model) healthy people may reproduce healthy and susceptible offspring.\n\nSome of these factors are summarized below with an explanation of how each one is treated in this model.\n\n### The density of the population\n\nPopulation density affects how often infected, immune and susceptible individuals come into contact with each other. You can change the size of the initial population through the PEOPLE slider.\n\n### Population turnover\n\nAs individuals die, some who die will be infected, some will be susceptible and some will be immune.  All the new individuals who are born, replacing those who die, will be susceptible.  People may die from the virus, the chances of which are determined by the slider CHANCE-RECOVER, or they may die of old age.  In this model, people die of old age at the age of approximately 27 years.  Reproduction rate is constant in this model.  Each turn, every healthy individual has a chance to reproduce.  That chance is set so that each person will on average reproduce four times if they live 27 years.\n\n### Degree of immunity\n\nIf a person has been infected and recovered, how immune are they to the virus?  We often assume that immunity lasts a lifetime and is assured, but in some cases immunity wears off in time and immunity might not be absolutely secure.  Nonetheless, in this model, immunity does last forever and is secure.\n\n### Infectiousness (or transmissibility)\n\nHow easily does the virus spread?  Some viruses with which we are familiar spread very easily.  Some viruses spread from the smallest contact every time.  Others (the HIV virus, which is responsible for AIDS, for example) require significant contact, perhaps many times, before the virus is transmitted.  In this model, infectiousness is determined by a slider.\n\n### Duration of infectiousness\n\nHow long is a person infected before they either recover or die?  This length of time is essentially the virus's window of opportunity for transmission to new hosts. In this model, duration of infectiousness is determined by a slider.\n\n## HOW TO USE IT\n\nEach \"tick\" represents a week in the time scale of this model.\n\nThe INFECTIOUSNESS slider determines how great the chance is that virus transmission will occur when an infected person and susceptible person occupy the same patch.  For instance, when the slider is set to 50, the virus will spread roughly once every two chance encounters.\n\nThe DURATION slider determines the percent of the average life-span (which is 1500 weeks, or approximately 27 years, in this model) that an infected person goes through before the infection ends in either death or recovery.  Note that although zero is a slider possibility, it produces an infection of very short duration (approximately 2 weeks) not an infection with no duration at all.\n\nThe CHANCE-RECOVERY slider controls the likelihood that an infection will end in recovery/immunity.  When this slider is set at zero, for instance, the infection is always deadly.\n\nThe SETUP button resets the graphics and plots and randomly distributes 140 green susceptible people and 10 red infected people (of randomly distributed ages).  The GO button starts the simulation and the plotting function.\n\nThree output monitors show the percent of the population that is infected, the percent that is immune, and the number of years that have passed.  The plot shows (in their respective colors) the number of susceptible, infected, and immune people.  It also shows the number of individuals in the total population in blue.\n\n## THINGS TO NOTICE\n\nThe factors controlled by the three sliders interact to influence how likely the virus is to thrive in this population.  Notice that in all cases, these factors must create a balance in which an adequate number of potential hosts remain available to the virus and in which the virus can adequately access those hosts.\n\nOften there will initially be an explosion of infection since no one in the population is immune and the population density is at its maximum.  This approximates the initial \"outbreak\" of a viral infection in a population, one that often has devastating consequences for the humans concerned. Soon, however, the virus becomes less common as the population dynamics change.  What ultimately happens to the virus is determined by the factors controlled the sliders.\n\nNotice that viruses that are too successful at first (infecting almost everyone) may not survive in the long term.  Since everyone infected generally dies or becomes immune as a result, the potential number of hosts is often limited.  The exception to the above is when the DURATION slider is set so high that population turnover (reproduction) can keep up and provide new hosts.\n\n## THINGS TO TRY\n\nThink about how different slider values might approximate the dynamics of real-life viruses.  The famous Ebola virus in central Africa has a very short duration, a very high infectiousness value, and an extremely low recovery rate. For all the fear this virus has raised, how successful is it?  Set the sliders appropriately and watch what happens.\n\nThe HIV virus which causes AIDS, has an extremely long duration, an extremely low recovery rate, but an extremely low infectiousness value.  How does a virus with these slider values fare in this model?\n\n## EXTENDING THE MODEL\n\nAdd additional sliders controlling the carrying capacity of the world (how many people can be in the world at one time) and the average lifespan of the people.\n\nBuild a similar model simulating viral infection of a non-human host with very different reproductive rates, lifespans, and population densities.\n\nAdd a slider controlling how long immunity lasts so that immunity is not perfect or eternal.\n\n## RELATED MODELS\n\n* AIDS\n* Virus on a Network\n\n## CREDITS AND REFERENCES";
                                  return Tortoise.fromCompiledModel('#model-container', widgets, code, info, '', true);
                                })();
                              var AgentModel = tortoise_require('agentmodel');
                        var Call = tortoise_require('util/call');
                        var ColorModel = tortoise_require('engine/core/colormodel');
                        var Dump = tortoise_require('engine/dump');
                        var Exception = tortoise_require('util/exception');
                        var Link = tortoise_require('engine/core/link');
                        var LinkSet = tortoise_require('engine/core/linkset');
                        var Meta = tortoise_require('meta');
                        var NLMath = tortoise_require('util/nlmath');
                        var NLType = tortoise_require('engine/core/typechecker');
                        var Nobody = tortoise_require('engine/core/nobody');
                        var PatchSet = tortoise_require('engine/core/patchset');
                        var PenBundle = tortoise_require('engine/plot/pen');
                        var Plot = tortoise_require('engine/plot/plot');
                        var PlotOps = tortoise_require('engine/plot/plotops');
                        var Random = tortoise_require('shim/random');
                        var StrictMath = tortoise_require('shim/strictmath');
                        var Tasks = tortoise_require('engine/prim/tasks');
                        var Turtle = tortoise_require('engine/core/turtle');
                        var TurtleSet = tortoise_require('engine/core/turtleset');
                        var notImplemented = tortoise_require('util/notimplemented');
                        var linkShapes = {"default":{"name":"default","direction-indicator":{"name":"link direction","editableColorIndex":0,"rotate":true,"elements":[{"x1":150,"y1":150,"x2":90,"y2":180,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true},{"x1":150,"y1":150,"x2":210,"y2":180,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true}]},"curviness":0.0,"lines":[{"x-offset":-0.2,"is-visible":false,"dash-pattern":[0.0,1.0]},{"x-offset":0.0,"is-visible":true,"dash-pattern":[1.0,0.0]},{"x-offset":0.2,"is-visible":false,"dash-pattern":[0.0,1.0]}]}};
                        var modelConfig = (typeof window.modelConfig !== "undefined" && window.modelConfig !== null) ? window.modelConfig : {};

1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true}]},"turtle":{"name":"turtle","editableColorIndex":0,"rotate":true,"elements":[{"xcors":[215,240,246,228,215,193],"ycors":[204,233,254,266,252,210],"type":"polygon","color":"rgba(89, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":false},{"xcors":[132,134,107,108,150,192,192,169,172],"ycors":[85,64,51,17,2,18,52,65,87],"type":"polygon","color":"rgba(89, 176, 60, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":false},{"xcors":[85,60,54,72,85,107],"ycors":[204,233,254,266,252,210],"type":"polygon","color":"rgba(89, 176, 60, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":false},{"xcors":[119,179,209,224,220,175,128,81,74,88],"ycors":[75,75,101,135,225,261,261,224,135,99],"type":"polygon","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":true}]},"wheel":{"name":"wheel","editableColorIndex":0,"rotate":false,"elements":[{"x":3,"y":3,"diam":294,"type":"circle","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":true},{"x":30,"y":30,"diam":240,"type":"circle","color":"rgba(0, 0, 0, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":false},{"x1":150,"y1":285,"x2":150,"y2":15,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true},{"x1":15,"y1":150,"x2":285,"y2":150,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true},{"x":120,"y":120,"diam":60,"type":"circle","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":true},{"x1":216,"y1":40,"x2":79,"y2":269,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true},{"x1":40,"y1":84,"x2":269,"y2":221,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true},{"x1":40,"y1":216,"x2":269,"y2":79,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true},{"x1":84,"y1":40,"x2":221,"y2":269,"type":"line","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":false,"marked":true}]},"x":{"name":"x","editableColorIndex":0,"rotate":false,"elements":[{"xcors":[270,225,30,75],"ycors":[75,30,225,270],"type":"polygon","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":true},{"xcors":[30,75,270,225],"ycors":[75,30,225,270],"type":"polygon","color":"rgba(141, 141, 141, 1.0)","filled":true,"marked":true}]}};
                        var modelPlotOps = (typeof modelConfig.plotOps !== "undefined" && modelConfig.plotOps !== null) ? modelConfig.plotOps : {};
                        if (typeof javax !== "undefined") {
                          modelConfig.output = {
                            clear: function() {},
                            write: function(str) { context.getWriter().print(str); }
                          }
                        }
                        modelConfig.plots = [(function() {
                          var name    = 'Populations';
                          var plotOps = (typeof modelPlotOps[name] !== "undefined" && modelPlotOps[name] !== null) ? modelPlotOps[name] : new PlotOps(function() {}, function() {}, function() {}, function() { return function() {}; }, function() { return function() {}; }, function() { return function() {}; }, function() { return function() {}; });
                          var pens    = [new PenBundle.Pen('sick', plotOps.makePenOps, false, new PenBundle.State(15.0, 1.0, PenBundle.DisplayMode.Line), function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'sick')(function() {}); });
                          }, function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() {
                              plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'sick')(function() {
                                plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?"); }).size());;
                              });
                            });
                          }),
                          new PenBundle.Pen('immune', plotOps.makePenOps, false, new PenBundle.State(5.0, 1.0, PenBundle.DisplayMode.Line), function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'immune')(function() {}); });
                          }, function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() {
                              plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'immune')(function() {
                                plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable("immune?"); }).size());;
                              });
                            });
                          }),
                          new PenBundle.Pen('healthy', plotOps.makePenOps, false, new PenBundle.State(55.0, 1.0, PenBundle.DisplayMode.Line), function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'healthy')(function() {}); });
                          }, function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() {
                              plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'healthy')(function() {
                                plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return (!SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?") && !SelfPrims.getVariable("immune?")); }).size());;
                              });
                            });
                          }),
                          new PenBundle.Pen('total', plotOps.makePenOps, false, new PenBundle.State(105.0, 1.0, PenBundle.DisplayMode.Line), function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'total')(function() {}); });
                          }, function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() {
                              plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', 'total')(function() { plotManager.plotValue(world.turtles().size());; });
                            });
                          })];
                          var setup   = function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', undefined)(function() {}); });
                          };
                          var update  = function() {
                            workspace.rng.withAux(function() { plotManager.withTemporaryContext('Populations', undefined)(function() {}); });
                          };
                          return new Plot(name, pens, plotOps, "weeks", "people", true, 0.0, 52.0, 0.0, 200.0, setup, update);
                        })()];
                        var workspace = tortoise_require('engine/workspace')(modelConfig)([])(["sick?", "immune?", "sick-count", "age"], [])(["duration", "chance-recover", "infectiousness", "people", "%infected", "%immune", "lifespan", "average-offspring", "carrying-capacity"], ["duration", "chance-recover", "infectiousness", "people"], [], -17, 17, -17, 17, 13.0, true, true, turtleShapes, linkShapes, function(){});
                        var BreedManager = workspace.breedManager;
                        var LayoutManager = workspace.layoutManager;
                        var LinkPrims = workspace.linkPrims;
                        var ListPrims = workspace.listPrims;
                        var MousePrims = workspace.mousePrims;
                        var OutputPrims = workspace.outputPrims;
                        var Prims = workspace.prims;
                        var PrintPrims = workspace.printPrims;
                        var SelfManager = workspace.selfManager;
                        var SelfPrims = workspace.selfPrims;
                        var Updater = workspace.updater;
                        var plotManager = workspace.plotManager;
                        var world = workspace.world;
                        var procedures = (function() {
                          var setup = function() {
                            world.clearAll();
                            Call(procedures.setupConstants);
                            Call(procedures.setupTurtles);
                            Call(procedures.updateGlobalVariables);
                            world.ticker.reset();
                          };
                          var setupTurtles = function() {
                            BreedManager.setDefaultShape(world.turtles().getBreedName(), "person")
                            world.turtleManager.createTurtles(world.observer.getGlobal("people"), "").ask(function() {
                              SelfPrims.setXY(world.topology.randomXcor(), world.topology.randomYcor());
                              SelfPrims.setVariable("age", Prims.random(world.observer.getGlobal("lifespan")));
                              SelfPrims.setVariable("sick-count", 0);
                              SelfPrims.setVariable("immune?", false);
                              SelfPrims.setVariable("size", 1.5);
                              Call(procedures.getHealthy);
                            }, true);
                            ListPrims.nOf(10, world.turtles()).ask(function() { Call(procedures.getSick); }, true);
                          };
                          var getSick = function() {
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("sick?", true);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("immune?", false);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("color", 15);
                          };
                          var getHealthy = function() {
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("sick?", false);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("immune?", false);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("sick-count", 0);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("color", 55);
                          };
                          var becomeImmune = function() {
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("sick?", false);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("sick-count", 0);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("immune?", true);
                            SelfPrims.setVariable("color", 5);
                          };
                          var setupConstants = function() {
                            world.observer.setGlobal("lifespan", 100);
                            world.observer.setGlobal("carrying-capacity", 750);
                            world.observer.setGlobal("average-offspring", 4);
                          };
                          var go = function() {
                            Call(procedures.getOlder);
                            Call(procedures.move);
                            Call(procedures.infect);
                            Call(procedures.recover);
                            Call(procedures.reproduce);
                            Call(procedures.updateGlobalVariables);
                            world.ticker.tick();
                          };
                          var updateGlobalVariables = function() {
                            if (Prims.gt(world.turtles().size(), 0)) {
                              world.observer.setGlobal("%infected", ((world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?"); }).size() / world.turtles().size()) * 100));
                              world.observer.setGlobal("%immune", ((world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable("immune?"); }).size() / world.turtles().size()) * 100));
                            }
                          };
                          var getOlder = function() {
                            world.turtles().ask(function() {
                              SelfPrims.setVariable("age", (SelfPrims.getVariable("age") + 1));
                              if (SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?")) {
                                SelfPrims.setVariable("sick-count", (SelfPrims.getVariable("sick-count") + 1));
                              }
                              if (Prims.gt(SelfPrims.getVariable("age"), world.observer.getGlobal("lifespan"))) {
                                SelfPrims.die();
                              }
                            }, true);
                          };
                          var move = function() {
                            world.turtles().ask(function() {
                              SelfPrims.right(Prims.random(100));
                              SelfPrims.left(Prims.random(100));
                              SelfPrims.fd(1);
                            }, true);
                          };
                          var infect = function() {
                            world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?"); }).ask(function() {
                              SelfPrims.other(SelfManager.self().turtlesHere().agentFilter(function() { return !SelfPrims.getVariable("immune?"); })).ask(function() {
                                if (Prims.lt(Prims.randomFloat(100), world.observer.getGlobal("infectiousness"))) {
                                  Call(procedures.getSick);
                                }
                              }, true);
                            }, true);
                          };
                          var recover = function() {
                            world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?"); }).ask(function() {
                              if (Prims.gt(Prims.random(SelfPrims.getVariable("sick-count")), (world.observer.getGlobal("lifespan") * (world.observer.getGlobal("duration") / 100)))) {
                                if (Prims.lt(Prims.randomFloat(100), world.observer.getGlobal("chance-recover"))) {
                                  Call(procedures.becomeImmune);
                                }
                                else {
                                  SelfPrims.die();
                                }
                              }
                            }, true);
                          };
                          var reproduce = function() {
                            world.turtles().agentFilter(function() { return !SelfPrims.getVariable("sick?"); }).ask(function() {
                              if ((Prims.lt(world.turtles().size(), world.observer.getGlobal("carrying-capacity")) && Prims.lt(Prims.random(world.observer.getGlobal("lifespan")), world.observer.getGlobal("average-offspring")))) {
                                SelfPrims.hatch(1, "").ask(function() {
                                  SelfPrims.setVariable("age", 1);
                                  SelfPrims.left(45);
                                  SelfPrims.fd(1);
                                  Call(procedures.getHealthy);
                                }, true);
                              }
                            }, true);
                          };
                          return {
                            "BECOME-IMMUNE":becomeImmune,
                            "GET-HEALTHY":getHealthy,
                            "GET-OLDER":getOlder,
                            "GET-SICK":getSick,
                            "GO":go,
                            "INFECT":infect,
                            "MOVE":move,
                            "RECOVER":recover,
                            "REPRODUCE":reproduce,
                            "SETUP":setup,
                            "SETUP-CONSTANTS":setupConstants,
                            "SETUP-TURTLES":setupTurtles,
                            "UPDATE-GLOBAL-VARIABLES":updateGlobalVariables,
                            "becomeImmune":becomeImmune,
                            "getHealthy":getHealthy,
                            "getOlder":getOlder,
                            "getSick":getSick,
                            "go":go,
                            "infect":infect,
                            "move":move,
                            "recover":recover,
                            "reproduce":reproduce,
                            "setup":setup,
                            "setupConstants":setupConstants,
                            "setupTurtles":setupTurtles,
                            "updateGlobalVariables":updateGlobalVariables
                          };
                        })();
                        world.observer.setGlobal("duration", 20);
                        world.observer.setGlobal("chance-recover", 50);
                        world.observer.setGlobal("infectiousness", 65);
                        world.observer.setGlobal("people", 150);
                        
                              session.startLoop()
